alert.note: Alert for Albany; Montgomery; Saratoga; Schenectady (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 19 at 12:16PM EST until February 19 at 1:15PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Schenectady County in east central New York... Northern Albany County in east central New York... Southern Saratoga County in east central New York... Southeastern Montgomery County in eastern New York... * Until 115 PM EST. * At 1216 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Galway to near Amsterdam to 6 miles north of Cobleskill, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 88 between exits 24 and 25. Interstate 90 between exits 25 and 27. Interstate 890 between exits 1a and 9. Interstate 87 between exits 4 and 7, and between exits 8A and 13N. Interstate 787 between exits 8 and 9. Locations impacted include... Schenectady, Clifton Park, Rotterdam, Saratoga Springs, Amsterdam, Cohoes, Watervliet, Colonie, Scotia, Mechanicville, Latham, Glenville, Niskayuna, Duanesburg, Ballston Spa, Green Island, Waterford, Altamont, Hagaman and Round Lake. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.
